Course Description: THIS IS AN INTRODUCTORY COURSE IN MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING WHICH EMPHASIZES THE USE OF ACCOUNTING DATA WITH RESPECT TO PLANNING OPERATIONS, BUDGETING, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND COST AND PROFIT ANALYSIS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENTS WILL: 
DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF COST AND MANAGERIAL TERMS FOR INTERNAL REPORTING PURPOSES

SET UP AND EXPLAIN JOB ORDER SYSTEMS AND PROCESS COST SYSTEMS

CALCULATE THE COST OF GOODS MANUFACTURED AND SOLD SCHEDULES

USE AVAILABLE DATA TO PREPARE VARIOUS BUDGETS

PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
